oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Hogs driven onto steamboat
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Laborers are gathering up hogs and guiding them up a wooden chute. From the chute they go onto a steamboat to send them off for slaughter. Most of the men pictured are African American.
It was common to send hogs off to slaughter by water rather than by land. If they were driven over land, they would lose weight and therefore depreciate in value.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Earl S. Miers River Photograph Collection
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African Americans; Swine; Corrals; Laborers; Agriculture
